3.1 M5a

I could not run JUnit plug-in tests when targetting 2.1.3. I would always get
the following error, regardless I chose the "special" headless application or
org.eclipse.ui.workbench. Using M4, it worked.

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 23, 2005 11:42:29.280
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Application not found:
org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime.legacyCoretestapplication.
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:856)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
    ...


Debugging, I noticed that only two applications were contributed by
org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime. The "legacy" applications were not. The reason is
 awrong markup used in the plugin.xml for org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime that
results in a valid plugin.xml (so the problem went undetected): the second
extension to the application extension actually contains the two other extension
elements.

As a side note, even after I fixed the problem above in my install, I could not
figure out how to run a 2.1.3 JUnit plug-in test in UI mode. It would always use
legacyCoretestapplication.
*** Bug 86449 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

that's one copy-and-paste job gone bad.
Fixed.  

Running 2.1.3 UI tests is also fine.  I just verified by running the JDT/UI 
tests.
The only know issue with 2.1.x Plugin JUnit testing is that the runtime window 
might have to be closed manually at the end of the test run.  This is because 
the 2.1.x UI code does not notify PDE when the tests are all run, so PDE uses 
a best guess, which is not accurate sometimes.  However, since Eclipse 2.1.x 
did not have Plugin JUnit testing anyway, even the ability to run 2.x Plugin 
Junit tests is a luxury courtesy of your PDE team ;-)
